install.description: Novint Technologies was looking to introduce a new PC Game controller with virtual 3D feed-back. They needed two identical vehicles to display at events all across the United States. The displays needed to be self contained and robust.
Some of the equipment to be installed.
The outsides were vinyl wrapped with all of Novints logos. Two removable custom tables holding three computers and three Falcon controllers each can be stored inside during travel.
Here is a close-up of the main attraction. Only one prototype Falcon controller was available during the build.
A 32" Vizio LCD was permanently mounted as a display for the main Dell computer. Alpine speakers, amp and a JL Audio subwoofer make sure the sound keeps up with the games.
The tables can easily be removed and stored diagonally in the back seat while traveling from event to event.
Made from half inch ¾" MDF and covered in grey formica, the tables are light enough to move easily and strong enough to hold all the computers, keyboards and Falcon controllers.

Special brackets with locking pins keep the tables secure while at a show. One of the requirements was to be able to set everything up within 30 minutes. With our design we were able to do it in just 12 minutes.
The Alpine amplifier and the main Dell computer were permanently mounted below the table.
A Panasonic HDD camera was installed to capture the players reaction once they experience the Falcon controller.
Four Optima deep cycle batteries now reside in the foot well of the rear seat. They supply enough power to run everything for over four hours without a power supply.
The battery-mount brackets prior to being painted.
These are the main frames welded out of square steel tubing that support the TV, speakers and table. They mount to existing mounts in the car.
All of the speaker baffles and inside tables were made out of MDF as well and covered in the same gray Formica.
Success, everyone was very impressed with the final product. We have gotten word after several months on the road that everything is holding up fine.
